name: 宾王斗地主
description:
The classic Landlord game, with regular games, ladder games, normal games, mangy games and plenty of great rewards waiting to be redeemed!
There are 13 legal types of tiles that can be played in Dojo.
(1) Single: the order of size from 3 (smallest) to King (largest).
(2) Pair: two cards of the same size, from 3 (smallest) to 2 (largest).
(3) Three: three cards of the same size.
(4) Three with one: three and bring any one card, e.g. 6-6-6-8, compared according to the size of the three cards, e.g. 9-9-9-3 over 8-8-8-A.
(5) Three with a pair: three and bring a pair, similar to a side road in poker (Full House), compared according to the size of the three cards, e.g. Q-Q-Q-6-6 over 10-10-10-K-K.
(6) Straight: at least five cards of consecutive sizes (from 3 to A, 2 and odd cannot be used), e.g. 8-9-10-J-Q.
(7) Consecutive pairs: at least 3 pairs of consecutive sizes (from 3 to A, 2 and odd cannot be used), e.g. 10-10-J-J-Q-Q-K-K.
(8) Three of a kind jokers: at least 2 three of a kind of consecutive size (from 3 to A), e.g. 4-4-4-5-5-5.
(9) Planes: each triple with an extra singleton, e.g. 7-7-7-8-8-8-3-6, able to bring a singleton 2 and a king, although a triple 2 is not available.
(10) Three cards with a pair of jokers: each of the three cards brings an extra pair, only the three cards need to be consecutive, for example 8-8-8-9-9-9-4-4-J-J, although the three 2s cannot be used, but can bring a pair of 2s [cannot bring a pair of kings, because the size of the two monsters is not the same], it should be noted here that the three cards with a single card and a pair cannot be mixed, for example 3-3-3-4-4-4-6-7-7 is not legal.
(11) Bombs: four cards of the same size, bombs can cover all other cards except rockets, and larger bombs can cover smaller ones.
(12) King Bomb: a pair of monsters, which is the largest combination, capable of covering any tile type including bombs.
(13) Four with two: There are two types of cards, a four with two singles, such as 6-6-6-6-6-8-9, or a four with two pairs, such as J-J-J-J-J-9-9-Q-Q. Four with two only compares according to the size of the four, and can only cover the same type of four with two that is smaller than itself [four with two and four with two pairs belong to different types of cards and cannot cover each other], and cannot cover other types of cards, and four with two can be covered by bombs that are smaller than itself.
